text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with green coconut chicken and no
we're not using green coconuts we're
using coconut milk and some green stuff
i don't want to call it a curry because
it's not like truly authentic and i
don't want to get in trouble with the
curry place and there has been known
instances of curry police brutality this
is just going to be called green coconut
chicken and here's what you do
so i'm going to take some neutral oil
i'm using grapeseed here you can use
vegetable oil i'm going to brown four
chicken legs season with salt on both
sides i'm going to brown those really
well on both sides on medium heat to the
proverbial golden brown and if i do say
so myself that is like absolutely golden
brown alright so just like that we're
going to remove those from the pan and
reserve and now for the green coconut
part i'm going to take some jalapeno
some green onion also known as scallion
some garlic cloves i'm going to add some
cilantro one can of coconut milk the
real stuff not the light one can of
coconut milk and then one can of water
we're going to whizz that up in the
blender until it's finally finally
finally pureed and liquefied and that's
going to be our braising liquid alright
to put this delicious green coconut
curry oops
nut curry this green coconut chicken
together i'm going to take some sliced
onions and some big chunks of ginger i'm
going to heat that a few drops of
vegetable oil and as soon as that starts
to sizzle i'm going to add red curry
powder now you're going to have to check
the blog post i'm going to give you the
exact measurement and the exact brand i
wanted to use spices you can find at any
major supermarket and i did okay
so we're going to toast that a little
bit we're going to warm that curry
powder up and really all that does the
heat just kind of wakes up the spice a
little bit alright so after that's
cooked for like a minute we're going to
put our chicken pieces back on top of
the aromatics
hello column aromatics I stole that from
Alton Brown we're going to pour in our
green coconut milk mixture and then a
little bit of fresh lime you can use
just regular old limes if you can't find
these cool very cool little key lines so
I'm using a couple of those and I'm
going to put the whole thing right in
just because I think it looks cool and
I don't mind a little touch of the
bitterness from the rind seeping into my
sauce but that's up to you as far as
salt we're going to add a little bit of
fish sauce you know I like to use my
fish sauce if you don't have that you
can use a splash of soy to taste and I'm
also going to put some brown sugar to
kind of balance the acidity all right
we're going to bring that to a simmer
make sure the chicken is pretty much
submerged put it on low and let it
simmer for 45 minutes so while that's
simmering we're going to prep our
vegetables and you can put almost
anything in this from potatoes to
zucchini to squash I'm going to use some
of these little eggplants which are very
cool-looking
all right you could use regular eggplant
those longer purplish Japanese eggplant
would be nice I'm also going to slice up
a yam here which is really just a sweet
potato but that's another story
so after 45 minutes of simmering the
chicken is fork tender and by the way
any time we do dishes like this you know
you got to skim any of the excess fat
that pulls up at the top and then I'm
going to use a strainer to fish out the
chicken pieces and reserve them on the
side because I want to cook the
vegetables right in that green coconut
braising liquid I don't want the chicken
in the way and I don't want to overcook
the chicken and have a fall part so I'm
gonna add the sweet potatoes I'm going
to bring it up to a boil I'm going to
toss in the eggplant or any other
vegetables I'm going to use and as soon
as those are tender you're ready to eat
basically the last major ingredient Thai
basil of course you can use regular
basil you knew you could use regular
basil but if you can find it try to get
Thai basil very intense very fragrant
very very interesting use that if you
can I didn't even chop it I just pulled
off all the leaves my hands just gave
them kind of a rough tear threw them in
of course please I beg you taste for
salt and pepper the fish sauce I added
is very salty so I just needed a pinch
of salt mine depending on if you use
fish sauce or not or soy you're going to
have to taste this for salt taste it for
spice you can always add some more hot
pepper if you want and you can even add
a little more brown sugar if you want to
give it a little more sweetness that's
up to you so to finish this off I'm
going to add my chicken pieces back in
cover it and just simmer that on low for
about five minutes to heat it through
alright that should be about it throw
this over some nice white rice the
contrast between the bland starchy rice
and the
full-flavored to say the least green
coconut chicken perfect perfect
combination
and like most braised dishes the meats
going to be fork tender just really
really moist and delicious all right
call it Thai if you want call it green
curry if you want I call it an easy and
delicious braised chicken dinner so go
to the site all the ingredients are
there and as always enjoy
